thread.title: British holidaymakers drown in Plett
thread.title_full: British holidaymakers drown in Plett | News24

author: news24.com
title: British holidaymakers drown in Plett
text:
Plettenberg Bay - Two British citizens, who were on holiday in Plettenberg Bay, have drowned, the National Sea Rescue Institute (NSRI) said on Saturday.
The bodies of a 28-year-old man and 26-year-old women were found washed up on Robberg Beach in shallow surf, NSRI spokesperson Craig Lambinon said.
Members of the public alerted NSRI about the bodies.
When rescuers arrived on the beach they performed CPR but after extensive effort both were declared dead.
